markdown:
<title level="1" right="Spell 9" pfs="Standard">
[Foresight](/Spells.aspx?ID=1537)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=104" />
<trait label="Mental" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=106" />
<trait label="Prediction" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=132" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 332 <sup>2.0</sup>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3)

**Bloodline**
[Angelic](/Bloodlines.aspx?ID=20)

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** touch

**Target** 1 creature
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 hour
</row>

</column>

---

You gain a sixth sense that warns you of danger that might befall the target of the spell. If you choose a creature other than yourself as the target, you create a psychic link through which you can inform the target of danger. This link is a [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106) effect. Due to the amount of information this spell requires you to process, you can't have more than one _foresight_ spell in effect at a time. Casting _foresight_ again ends the previous _foresight_.

 While _foresight_ is in effect, the target gains a +2 status bonus to initiative rolls and isn't [off-guard](/Conditions.aspx?ID=58) against [undetected](/Conditions.aspx?ID=39) creatures or when flanked. In addition, you gain the following reaction.

 **Foresight** <actions string="Reaction" /> **Trigger** The target of _foresight_ defends against a hostile creature or other danger; **Effect** If the hostile creature or danger forces the target to roll dice (a saving throw, for example), the target rolls twice and uses the higher result, and this spell gains the [fortune](/Traits.aspx?ID=76) trait. But if the hostile creature or danger is rolling against the target (an attack roll or skill check, for example), that hostile creature or danger rolls twice and uses the lower result, and this spell gains the [misfortune](/Traits.aspx?ID=110) trait.
name: Foresight

<traits>
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=104" />
<trait label="Mental" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=106" />

</traits>

<additional-info>
**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 332 <sup>2.0</sup>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3)

**Bloodline**
[Angelic](/Bloodlines.aspx?ID=20)

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** touch

 

**Target** 1 creature
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 hour
</row>
</additional-info>

---

<summary>
Danger sense warns you when a creature is in danger and protects it with good fortune.
</summary>
summary: Danger sense warns you when a creature is in danger and protects it with good fortune.
summary_markdown: Danger sense warns you when a creature is in danger and protects it with good fortune.
text: Foresight Two Actions Source Player Core pg. 332 2.0 Traditions Arcane, Divine, Occult Bloodline Angelic Range touch Target 1 creature Duration 1 hour --- You gain a sixth sense that warns you of danger that might befall the target of the spell. If you choose a creature other than yourself as the target, you create a psychic link through which you can inform the target of danger. This link is a mental effect. Due to the amount of information this spell requires you to process, you can't have more than one foresight spell in effect at a time. Casting foresight again ends the previous foresight . While foresight is in effect, the target gains a +2 status bonus to initiative rolls and isn't off-guard against undetected creatures or when flanked. In addition, you gain the following reaction. Foresight Reaction Trigger The target of foresight defends against a hostile creature or other danger; Effect If the hostile creature or danger forces the target to roll dice (a saving throw, for example), the target rolls twice and uses the higher result, and this spell gains the fortune trait. But if the hostile creature or danger is rolling against the target (an attack roll or skill check, for example), that hostile creature or danger rolls twice and uses the lower result, and this spell gains the misfortune trait.
